results.title: The World of work
results.brief_description: A series of short films which look at different aspects of work in Australia. Of particular interest to adolescents. Teacher’s notes accompany the videos.

group_works.title: TV news: behind the scenes
group_works.creator_credit: Randolph Hobler, Michael Livesey, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Microchips rule OK
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of work”.
A short and impressionistic film which poses the question are computers a good or bad thing for the workforce? Includes interviews with unemployed youth, workers and archival footage of the introduction of computers into the workplace. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

group_siblings.title: TV news: behind the scenes
group_siblings.creator_credit: Randolph Hobler, Michael Livesey, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: TV news: behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: Randolph Hobler, Michael Livesey, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of work”.
Follows one day’s preparation of an evening TV news broadcast at a major New York studio, showing how stories are assigned and reported, with examples of on the spot coverage. Concentrates on the editorial and technical teamwork involved in the selection and final preparation of news stories to be presented on air, with special emphasis on the contributions of key members of the newsroom staff. Narrated by John Barnes.

group_works.title: Vatican: fortress of christianity
group_works.creator_credit: Ontario Educational Communications Authority and World Films Production

results.title: Vatican: fortress of christianity
results.creator_credit: Ontario Educational Communications Authority and World Films Production
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Countries and peoples”.
Traces the historical development of the catholic religion in Europe and the world, and the establishment of the Vatican as the spiritual centre of Christianity. Looks at Saint Peter’s Basilica and other examples of Roman architecture.

group_works.title: The Magic boomerang: Double trouble
group_works.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams and Pacific Films

results.title: The Magic boomerang: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams and Pacific Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Magic Boomerang”.
One of a series made for children’s television. The story is set in a country town where the boy “hero” of the series, Nuggett, gets involved in a plot to defraud a man of some land. The whole plot is thwarted with the help of Nuggett and his friend and the magic boomerang. The owner and his land are saved in a happy ending.

results.title: Rikki-tikki-tavi
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Chuck Jones Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
An animated version of Rudyard Kipling’s tale of a mongoose who is saved from a storm by a boy and his parents, and then becomes the family’s defender against the dreaded cobras that roam the compound. Narrated by Orson Welles. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The White seal
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Chuck Jones Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
Based on a tale in Kipling’s “The Jungle Book”, this exciting animated film follows the exploits of Kotick, the white seal, as he struggles to survive and save his friends from seal hunters in the Bering Sea. Narrated by Roddy McDowall to music from Beethoven’s Sixth Symphony. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.
